concept.title: SNMP GET OIDs
concept.shortdesc: There are several object identifiers (OID) available from the system via SNMP from the network management card (NMC). The OIDs needs to be requested with a GET from a MIB browser with correctly configured access to the NMC. The OIDs can show both analog and digital values, see respective section.

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: List of SNMP analog OIDs and their meanings exposed by the network management card, for retrieving sensor and analog telemetry values.

othermeta.name: entities
othermeta.content: snmp agent; analog oids; sensor channels; network management card AP9635; mib entries

section.title: Analog Values from OIDs
section.p: The following table shows the analog values that are available as GET requests.
section.note: Base OID Address for APC / Reality: .1.3.6.1.4.1.318.
If an OID is not supported for the system the displayed value will be -1 (or if the OID returns a string instead of an integer it will display “NOT SUPPORTED”).

entry.p: Index based for three phase systems (2.1.1-2.1.3)
Index based for three phase systems (1.1.1-1.1.3)
Index based for three phase systems (1.1.1-1.1.3)
Index based for three phase systems (1.1.1-1.1.3)
Only available if optional Reality battery ABM is installed in the system.
Factor 10. The actual measured value is multiplied with a factor 10.
Only available if optional Reality battery ABM is installed in the system.
Factor 10. The actual measured value is multiplied with a factor 10.

section.title: Digital Values from OIDs
section.p: There are some specific OIDs that generate a string of zeros and ones, where certain positions in the string indicates an alarm. For details see the table for the respective OID.

The first (left most) character has the position 1, the last (right most) character has the position 64. For example, if the OID 1.1.1.11.2.1 has the string ‘0000000100 0000000000 0000000000 0000000000 0000000000 0000000000 0000’ it would indicate that the bypass voltage out of range, since the character position 8 has the value 1. For example, if the OID 1.1.1.11.2.1 have the string ‘0000000000 0000000000 0001000000 0000000000 0000000000 0000000000 0000’ it would indicate that the battery breaker is open, since the character position 24 has the value 1. For example, if the OID 1.1.1.11.2.1 have the string ‘0000000000 0000000000 0000000000 0000000000 0001000000 0000000000 0000’ it would indicate that the relay board 1, input 5 is closed, since the character position 44 has the value 1.
section.note: The spaces in the string is only shown to make it easier to read in the example, the string value from the SNMP OID does not contain any spaces.
Only the descriptions for the character positions that are relevant for the system type are shown. The same OID can be used for multiple systems types.

entry.p: Bypass voltage (average) is out of tolerance
Output is out of tolerance detected
Indicates that the output voltage of the UPS is out of tolerance. The system will transfer to bypass if the bypass mains is within tolerance, if not the system will shut down.
The DC is above the high DC warning level.
The common alarm is active in the system.
The DC is above the high DC warning level.
The common alarm is active in the system.
The UPS output voltage is out of tolerance.
The output voltage on the secondary side of the output transformer is out of tolerance.
The UPS output is overloaded (>100%) or the inverter current limiter is active.
Battery voltage above the high battery shut-down level.
Battery voltage above the high battery warning level (no warning in battery operation).
Battery voltage below the low battery warning level.
Battery voltage below low battery shut-down level.
The interface has detected a battery positive earth fault (if available).
The interface has detected a battery negative earth fault (if available).
The rectifier mains input switch Q001 is closed.
The battery switch Q201 is closed.
The bypass mains input switch Q501 is closed.
The bypass transformer output switch Q502 is closed.
The load output switch Q611 is closed.
The SBS input switch Q691 is closed.
The UPS output switch Q692 is closed.
One or more bypass faults are detected.
One or more mains faults are detected.
One or more output faults are detected.
Overtemperature in PM or transformers detected (if available).
The battery voltage is out of tolerance or the runtime is too short.
The rectifier mains is out of tolerance.
The current in the AC capacitors is below the low shutdown limit value.
An internal serial error within the systems control electronic has occurred.
The current in the AC capacitors is below the low warning limit value.
The system charger is operating in total DC current limit mode.
Static switch EA temperature warning or static switch EN temperature warning detected
One of the system static switch modules (EA or EN) has a temperature warning signal pending.
Output voltage is out of tolerance
A temperature shutdown alarm is active in one of the system charger modules.
A temperature warning is active in one of the system charger modules.
Inverter PM block 1 (L1, L2, L3) temperature shutdown
A temperature shutdown alarm is active in one of the system inverter power modules.
Only available if optional Reality battery ABM is installed in the system.
Only available if optional Reality battery ABM is installed in the system.
The temperature on the charger magnetic is too high.
Possibly one or more of the following: rectifier fuse blown, battery breaker (Q004) disconnected, DC earth fault (Option 1), Option 2..6, manual bypass switch.
One or more of the inverter fuses have blown (F021 on A071: X003:1). The inverter turns off. The system switches to bypass if possible or it shuts down.
The system is locked in an operation mode. The system was changing operation mode too frequently.
The battery temperature is too high.
One of the two internal power supplies has a fault.
The inverter voltage before the static switch EA is about <85% of the reference voltage. If the inverter turns on or if system is in bypass operation the static switch EA is blocked.
One or more fans are inoperable.
Only available if an advances battery monitor (ABM) is installed.
Half of the battery voltage is outside of the tolerance window. Only available if an advances battery monitor (ABM) is installed.
Fan 1,2,3,4,5,6,7 or 8 is rotating to slowly, the tan pulse signal is less than 20 Hz.
The temperature is too high at the transformer.
The DC or AC circuit of the redundant PSU is inoperable.
Earth current is running to positive pole or earth current is running to ground pole.
Current limiter for the total DC current is active.
The rectifier DC fuse has blown.
DC voltage is below low DC warning level.
Phase order not correct, or mains voltage is out of tolerance window, or mains is out of frequency window, or at least one phase is missing. Charger will shut down.
The digital input of emergency power off (EPO) is activated (contact open) or the EPO wiring is disconnected.
The battery temperature exceeds the programmed warning level.
1 = the system is in standby operation.
1 = the system is in battery operation.
1 = the system is in normal operation.
The system is in static bypass operation due to a user request.
The system is in static bypass operation due to a fault.
The battery charger has been set to float charge state. The batteries are charged with a float charge voltage.
The battery charger has been set to boost charge mode. The batteries are charged with a boost charge voltage.
The battery charger has been set to initial charge mode. The batteries are charged with a initial charge voltage.
The battery charger has been set to cyclic charge mode. The batteries are charged with a cyclic charge voltage.
The manual bypass switch Q601 in the test position.
The manual bypass switch Q601 in the bypass position.
An overtemperature at the rectifier mains transformer is detected.
An overtemperature at the output transformer is detected.
An overtemperature at the bypass transformer is detected.
The battery temperature exceeds the programmed shutdown level.
The temperature sensor, connected to the external connection board, is over the temperature warning level.
The temperature sensor, connected to the external connection board, is over the temperature warning level.
The temperature sensor, connected to the external connection board, is over the temperature warning level.
The mains input transformer temperature sensor PT100 is not connected or shorted.
The output transformer temperature sensor PT100 is not connected or shorted.
The bypass transformer temperature sensor PT100 is not connected or shorted.
The rectifier mains voltage is out of tolerance.
The rectifier mains voltage on primary side of the input transformer is out of tolerance. This event is only active if a transformer is installed.
The bypass voltage is out of tolerance.
The bypass mains voltage on the primary side of bypass transformer is out of tolerance. This event is only active if a transformer and the bypass measurement is installed.
